/* U8G_PROGMEM is used by the XBM example */
unit.typedef: typedef uint8_t (*u8g_dev_fnptr)(void *u8g, void *dev, uint8_t msg, void *arg);
typedef uint8_t (*u8g_com_fnptr)(void *u8g, uint8_t msg, uint8_t arg_val, void *arg_ptr);
typedef uint8_t (*u8g_dev_fnptr)(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t msg, void *arg);
typedef uint8_t (*u8g_com_fnptr)(u8g_t *u8g, uint8_t msg, uint8_t arg_val, void *arg_ptr);
unit.comment: /* Size: 128x64 monochrom, no output, used for performance measure */
/* T6963, all t6963 devices have double page (2x) */
/* Display: EA DOGXL160, Size: 160x104 monochrom & gray level */
/* faster, but uses private tables from the Arduino Library */
/* NHD-2.7-12864UCY3 OLED Display with SSD1325 Controller */
/* LY120 OLED with SSD1327 Controller (tested with Seeedstudio module) */
/* NHD-3.12-25664 OLED Display with SSD1322 Controller */
unit.function_decl: void u8g_SetFlipDiscCallback(u8g_t *u8g, void (*cb)(uint8_t id, uint8_t page, uint8_t width, uint8_t *row1, uint8_t *row2));
unit.comment: /* arg: pointer to uint8_t, contranst value between 0 and 255 */
/* new algorithm with U8G_DEV_MSG_GET_PAGE_BOX makes this msg obsolete */
/* arg: u8g_box_t *, fill structure with current page properties */
/* uncomment the following line for Atmega HW SPI double speed, issue 89 */
/* CHIP_SELECT argument: number of the chip which needs to be activated, so this is more like high active */

unit.comment: /* create internal number from port and pin */
/* u8g level procedures, expect U8G_PI_xxx macro */
unit.function_decl: void u8g_SetPILevel(u8g_t *u8g, uint8_t pi, uint8_t level);
void u8g_page_Init(u8g_page_t *p, u8g_uint_t page_height, u8g_uint_t total_height ) U8G_NOINLINE;
uint8_t u8g_pb_IsYIntersection(u8g_pb_t *pb, u8g_uint_t v0, u8g_uint_t v1);
uint8_t u8g_pb_IsXIntersection(u8g_pb_t *b, u8g_uint_t v0, u8g_uint_t v1);
unit.comment:
/* note on __attribute__ ((nocommon)) AVR scripts often use --gc-sections on the linker to remove unused section. This works fine for initialed data and text sections. In principle .bss is also handled, but the name##_pb definition is not removed. Reason is, that array definitions are placed in the COMMON section, by default The attribute "nocommon" removes this automatic assignment to the COMMON section and directly puts it into .bss. As a result, if more than one buffer is defined in one file, then it will be removed with --gc-sections
.. not sure if Arduino IDE uses -fno-common... if yes, then the attribute is redundant. */
unit.cpp:define: #define U8G_PB_DEV(name, width, height, page_height, dev_fn, com_fn) \ uint8_t name##_buf[width] U8G_NOCOMMON ; \ u8g_pb_t name##_pb = { {page_height, height, 0, 0, 0}, width, name##_buf}; \ u8g_dev_t name = { dev_fn, &name##_pb, com_fn }
unit.function_decl: void u8g_pb8v1_Init(u8g_pb_t *b, void *buf, u8g_uint_t width) U8G_NOINLINE;
uint8_t u8g_pb8v1_IsYIntersection(u8g_pb_t *b, u8g_uint_t v0, u8g_uint_t v1);
uint8_t u8g_pb8v1_IsXIntersection(u8g_pb_t *b, u8g_uint_t v0, u8g_uint_t v1);
uint8_t u8g_dev_pb8v1_base_fn(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t msg, void *arg);
uint8_t u8g_dev_pb16v1_base_fn(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t msg, void *arg);
uint8_t u8g_dev_pb14v1_base_fn(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t msg, void *arg);
uint8_t u8g_dev_pb8v2_base_fn(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t msg, void *arg);
uint8_t u8g_dev_pb16v2_base_fn(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t msg, void *arg);
uint8_t u8g_dev_pb8h1_base_fn(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t msg, void *arg);
uint8_t u8g_dev_pb16h1_base_fn(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t msg, void *arg);
uint8_t u8g_dev_pb32h1_base_fn(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t msg, void *arg);

unit.comment: /* Feb 2013: A0 state moved from 7 to 3 for t6963 controller*/
/* data pins, shared with SPI and I2C pins */
/* read/write pin, must be the last pin in the list, this means U8G_PIN_LIST_LEN = U8G_PI_RW + 1*/
unit.function_decl: uint8_t u8g_call_dev_fn(u8g_t *u8g, u8g_dev_t *dev, uint8_t msg, void *arg);

unit.comment: /* the following values are bit masks */
unit.function_decl: uint8_t u8g_i2c_wait(uint8_t mask, uint8_t pos) U8G_NOINLINE;
unit.comment: /* v = value, d = number of digits */
/* v = value, d = number of digits */
/* delay by the specified number of milliseconds */
/* Free-Universal Bold r: Reduced char set (codes 32 - 128) n: Numbers (codes 42 - 57) no char: Full set (codes 32 - 255) */
/* Free-Universal Regular r: Reduced char set (codes 32 - 128) n: Numbers (codes 42 - 57) no char: Full set (codes 32 - 255) */
/* Gentium Bold r: Reduced char set (codes 32 - 128) n: Numbers (codes 42 - 57) no char: Full set (codes 32 - 255) */
/* Gentium Regular r: Reduced char set (codes 32 - 128) n: Numbers (codes 42 - 57) no char: Full set (codes 32 - 255) */
/* Old-Standard Bold r: Reduced char set (codes 32 - 128) n: Numbers (codes 42 - 57) no char: Full set (codes 32 - 255) */
/* Old-Standard Regular r: Reduced char set (codes 32 - 128) n: Numbers (codes 42 - 57) no char: Full set (codes 32 - 255) */
